summaryText: Wow, what a powerful sermon about sharing your story and spreading the gospel! Pastor Travis Hearn delivered an incredible message challenging every believer to be bold in sharing their faith. He passionately explained that our personal testimonies have incredible power - the power to set people free, bring healing, and ultimately lead others to salvation. PT reminded us that we're not just passive observers, but active participants in God's mission. Think about it - you might be the only 'Jesus' someone ever encounters! The early church grew exponentially through persecution, and today we have unprecedented freedom to share the gospel. But are we using that freedom? Pastor Travis challenged us to stop being silent and start being vocal about what God has done in our lives. His core message was simple yet profound: your story matters, and it has the potential to transform lives. Whether you've experienced incredible miracles or walked through deep valleys, your testimony can be a beacon of hope for someone struggling. The sermon wasn't just a call to evangelism, but an invitation to participate in God's redemptive plan. As Pastor Travis said, 'When God truly gets a hold of you and changes your life, you cannot help but talk about it!'
mainPoints: Tell your story because it holds the power to set people free
Share your testimony because it can bring healing to others
Your personal story carries the power of salvation

versesMentioned.text: Then they called them in again and commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus. But Peter and John replied, 'Which is right in God's eyes: to listen to you, or to him? Judge for yourselves! As for us, we cannot help speaking about what we have seen and heard.'

'The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim freedom for the prisoners and recovery of sight for the blind, to set the oppressed free.'
Then you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.
Jesus answered, 'I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.'
Who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God.
For I am not ashamed of the gospel, because it is the power of God that brings salvation to everyone who believes: first to the Jew, then to the Gentile.

'You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything, except to be thrown out and trampled underfoot. You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.'

Monday.scripture: Romans 10:14: 'How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them?'
Monday.focus: Understanding the importance of personal evangelism
Monday.action: Make a list of 3-5 people in your life who might not know Jesus. Commit to praying specifically for their salvation this week.
Monday.prayer: Lord, give me courage to share Your love. Help me see opportunities to share my testimony and Your transformative power. Make me sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 1 Peter 3:15: 'But in your hearts revere Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect.'
Tuesday.action: Write out your personal testimony in 3-5 minutes. Practice sharing it conversationally with a friend or family member.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me articulate the story of Your work in my life. Give me clarity and boldness to share what You've done for me. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Matthew 28:19-20: 'Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you.'
Wednesday.action: Research local or global mission opportunities. Consider how you might support gospel spreading beyond your immediate community.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, expand my vision for Your kingdom. Show me how I can participate in spreading Your gospel locally and globally. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Philemon 1:6: 'I pray that the sharing of your faith may become effective and powerful as you understand every good thing we have in Christ.'
Thursday.action: Listen to a podcast or read a book about personal evangelism. Learn new strategies for sharing your faith naturally.
Thursday.prayer: Holy Spirit, guide my conversations. Help me share Your love authentically and powerfully. Give me wisdom and sensitivity. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Acts 1:8: 'But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.'
Friday.action: Reflect on areas where you've been hesitant to share your faith. Surrender those fears to God and ask for boldness.
Friday.prayer: Father, break down my walls of fear. Fill me with Your Holy Spirit's power and courage. Help me trust You in sharing my story. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Proverbs 11:30: 'The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and the one who is wise saves lives.'
Saturday.focus: Understanding the life-changing power of testimony
Saturday.action: Intentionally look for an opportunity to encourage someone with your story of God's faithfulness this week.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, make me a vessel of Your hope and healing. Use my story to point others toward Your transformative love. Give me divine appointments. Amen.
